name: Modulator
definition: Variation that activates or represses the genetic machinery.

name: Modifier
definition: Variation that modifies one or more aspects of a disease, such as temporal pattern, age of onset and mortality.

name: Mediator
definition: Variation that increases cell proliferation, pluripotency or survival in cancer.

name: Risk factor
definition: Variation that increases the genetic susceptibility of a disease.

name: Protective factor
definition: Variation that reduces the risk of developing a disease or delays onset.

name: Incidental finding
definition: An abnormality noted on diagnostic testing that was not related to the reason that prompted the analysis.

name: Low penetrance
definition: Variation with a low probability of expression as a phenotype.

name: Not related to clinical phenotype
definition: Variation is not related to clinical phenotype.
